entry.title: Let Me Have One Good Thing
entry.summary:
Author: lushescape

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,570Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 1

Summary: He doesn't remember the last time he met someone like you. Someone who made his stomach twist and coil in the most uncomfortable ways, someone who made his heart pitter patter - he broke into the cave one night and insisted that Alfred hook him up to every machine at their disposal to make sure he wasn't having a heart attack. When Alfred asked what brought on the sudden heart palpitations Jason refused to tell him it was because you smiled at him and ruffled his hair like a child. Or You're the one good thing Jason's had in his life in a long time, too bad he's doomed by the narrative

entry.title: Dedicated
entry.summary:
Author: writerclaire

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,827Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 30

Summary: You haven’t been happy in years, but being a successful author meant you had a roof over your head and food was always available. You were content. However, your peaceful hermit days are threatened when the hate mail becomes very real death threats and you are forced to accept a bodyguard. Jason Todd didn’t have a lot to be thankful for. Shitty dad, missing mom. Homelessness. Then came another shitty dad. Oh, and he died once, after he was tortured by an evil clown. Now he’s back. He doesn’t understand how it’s possible but all he knows is that despite everything that’s happened to him, revenge is the second most important thing to him. His priority now is to protect the girl he left behind.

  • No Archive Warnings Apply

There we go, you must be feeling better already."

entry.title: if you were so inclined
entry.summary:
Author: aceofspadesss

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 112Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 1

Summary: "Every great love starts with a great story..." - The Notebook   Forty seven minutes. It took Jason Todd exactly forty seven minutes, on his motorcycle, without traffic, to get to this bookstore. The closest bookstore to his apartment was a three minute walk. Not that he'd ever choose to go to that one. No, something about this bookstore was... magical. It felt like walking into a movie, with the soft classical music and faint smell of coffee running through the air. Lights that were soft on the eyes and a temperature that was never too cold, but just cold enough to warrant a sweater. It was perfect. Or maybe it was just you.

entry.title: Strawberry Waffles
entry.summary:
Author: lushescape

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,108Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 92

Summary: “Like a date?” You ask in a near whisper. Jason looks like he's been electrocuted but slowly he nods his head twice. “Yeah. A date. You and me, the school dance.” Oh. Your heart feels like it's beating so fast it's going to stop at any second. But you nod, your face warm, and there's no way you can stop yourself from smiling now. “Um, y- yeah.” You stammer before clearing your throat softly. “Yes.” You say, more confident in your answer. “Yes, I would.. love to go with you. On a date. To the dance.” Or Jason Todd becomes a girl dad after dying and coming back to life
